hypotheses.statement: Tail-risk markets (probability <5%) are systematically overpriced due to fear/uncertainty premium
hypotheses.rationale: Markets like nuclear detonation (1.5%), recession (1.5%), USDT depeg (0.45%) may reflect fear rather than rational probability. If base rates are even lower, there's edge in selling these contracts.
hypotheses.testMethod: Compare implied probabilities to historical base rates and expert forecasts. Track P&L on small NO positions in tail-risk markets.

evidence.observation: Nuclear detonation market: Polymarket 1.55% vs expert estimates ~1-2% annual. No clear mispricing detected.
US Recession 2025 market: Polymarket 2.5% is reasonable given only 24 days left in year and no recession declared. Earlier in year market showed 40-66% when experts forecast 33-60%.
USDT depeg market: 0.45% seems appropriately low given USDT's historical stability through crises.

hypotheses.conclusion: Invalidated. Examined 3 tail-risk markets, all showed efficient pricing aligned with expert estimates. No systematic overpricing found. Polymarket participants appear to price tail risks rationally.

hypotheses.statement: Markets approaching resolution (closing within 7 days) exhibit price momentum that continues until resolution
hypotheses.rationale: As information crystallizes near resolution, early movers may create momentum. Late traders pile in, pushing prices further in the direction of the likely outcome.
hypotheses.testMethod: Track price movements in final 7 days before resolution. Look for continuation patterns. Paper trade momentum strategy on closing-soon markets.

evidence.observation: Scan of closing-soon markets: Found 8 Fed rate decision markets (Dec 10) - 97% volume concentrated in '8+ cuts' market ($1.38M/day). Markets at extreme prices (near-binary outcomes), making momentum less observable. Need markets in 40-60% range for proper momentum testing.

Largest Company EOY 2025: NVDA 90% (up from 89%), AAPL 8.7% (down from 9%). Slight movement toward winner (NVDA) and away from challenger (AAPL). Could support momentum hypothesis but sample size n=1 and movement <1% is within noise.

Time Person of Year 2025: AI leads at 39%, Jensen Huang 21%, Sam Altman 14%. Market closing Dec 31 - good candidate for momentum tracking over next 23 days. Need to establish baseline prices today for comparison.

Time Person of Year 2025 - First price check 3.3 hours after baseline: AI down 1.28% (0.39->0.385), Jensen Huang down 7.14% (0.21->0.195), Sam Altman down 10.71% (0.14->0.125), Trump flat (0.05->0.05). ALL candidates declining. Contradicts momentum hypothesis prediction that leader should gain relative to field. Instead market consolidating with broader compression of probability across all candidates.

Time POY 2025 - 6h check: Prices reverted to baseline (AI 39%, Jensen 21%, Sam 14%, Trump 5%). Earlier dip was noise, not signal. Market showing mean-reversion, not momentum. Insufficient data to validate or invalidate - need more observation over days, not hours.

Market scan check: Time POY prices stable at baseline (AI 39%, Jensen 21%, Sam 13%, Pope 8%, Trump 5%). Largest Company: NVDA 91% (+1), AAPL 7.8% (-1.2). Slight momentum toward leader NVDA, slight away from challenger AAPL. Consistent with weak momentum hypothesis but data still too noisy for conviction.

Experiment progress (24h check): Time POY prices still near baseline - AI 39% (flat), Jensen 21% (flat), Sam Altman 13% (-1pp from 14%), Trump 5.1% (+0.1). Largest Company: NVDA 91% (flat), AAPL 7.4% (-0.1pp). After ~24h of tracking, markets show stability rather than momentum. Sam Altman's 1pp decline is the only notable movement - could be noise or early sign of momentum away from mid-tier candidates. Need to continue tracking for multi-day patterns.

Fed rate cuts 2025 (8+) market closing Dec 10: YES at 0.05%, NO at 99.95%. Market correctly priced as 8+ cuts is mathematically impossible (only 3 cuts have occurred, max possible is 4 with Dec meeting). Not useful for momentum testing - extreme prices reflect settled outcome, not tradeable momentum. PASS on this market.

48h tracking check: Largest Company shows clear momentum - NVDA 91%→93% (+2pp), AAPL 7.4%→6.1% (-1.3pp). Time POY shows mixed signals - AI 39%→42% (+3pp supports), Jensen 21%→20% (-1pp contra), Sam 13%→16% (+3pp supports). Overall pattern: leaders gaining in both markets over 48h period. Weak support for momentum hypothesis.

hypotheses.statement: Polymarket liquidity rewards create +EV market making opportunities despite adverse selection risk
hypotheses.rationale: Polymarket pays market makers via two programs: daily rewards for limit orders (quadratic scoring, 3x bonus for two-sided quotes) and 4% APY holding rewards on 13 markets. If rewards exceed adverse selection costs, market making is profitable without directional edge.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Query CLOB API for max_incentive_spread and min_incentive_size per market. 2. Calculate reward/spread ratios. 3. Build simple MM bot for paper trading in low-volatility markets. 4. Track: spread P&L, rewards earned, adverse selection losses.

evidence.observation: Research confirms rewards are NOT risk-free. Two programs: (1) Daily liquidity rewards with quadratic scoring - closer to midpoint = higher rewards, 3x multiplier for two-sided quotes, (2) 4% APY holding rewards on 13 long-term markets. Reported earnings: $200-800/day for active MMs during peak. Post-2024 election: rewards reduced significantly. Requires: significant capital, automated execution, sophisticated pricing. Competition 'not fierce' currently but window likely narrowing.

Deep analysis of liquidity rewards program completed. CLOB API analysis shows: daily rates $1-20/market (typical $2-5), spreads 3.5¢ typical, min capital ~$100/market. To achieve reported $200-800/day earnings requires $5k-20k deployed across 50-100 markets. Calculated returns: 30-50% APY possible after adverse selection losses. Two-sided 3x bonus confirmed. Post-election reward reduction noted. Conclusion: +EV opportunity exists but requires: (1) significant capital $10k+, (2) sophisticated automated bot (2-4 week build), (3) active risk management. NOT "easy money" or risk-free. Recommendation: DEFER - high infrastructure barrier vs other faster-to-test hypotheses.

Comprehensive liquidity rewards analysis completed. Key findings: (1) Genuine +EV opportunity exists with 30-50% APY at 0k+ capital, (2) NOT risk-free - adverse selection costs 70-90% of gross spread, (3) Requires 4-7 week development timeline for competitive bot, (4) Infrastructure: WebSocket feeds, automated order placement, inventory tracking, (5) Competition increasing but not saturated - "1-2 bots per market" currently, (6) Breakeven spread: 0.2-0.5¢ on markets with k+ daily turnover, (7) Daily rewards: -5 per market typical, (8) Post-election reward reduction confirmed but not quantified. RECOMMENDATION: DEFER - high infrastructure barrier vs faster-to-test hypotheses (sports, momentum, arbitrage). Revisit after validating 2-3 simpler strategies. Full analysis: hyp-003-liquidity-rewards-analysis.md

nextSteps: If pursued: Start with 5-10 NBA prop markets (mid-tier volume)
Build MVP bot using warproxxx/poly-maker as template
Paper trade for 2 weeks before risking capital
hypotheses.recommendation: DEFER - Opportunity is genuine (+EV, 30-50% APY possible) but requires: $10k+ capital, 4-7 weeks dev time, WebSocket infrastructure, sophisticated pricing. High barrier vs faster-to-test hypotheses (sports, momentum). Revisit after validating 2-3 simpler strategies.

hypotheses.statement: Top traders on the Polymarket leaderboard exhibit identifiable patterns that can inform profitable trading strategies
hypotheses.rationale: The weekly profit leaderboard reveals who is consistently winning. Analyzing their trading patterns (market selection, timing, position sizing) could reveal edge. Source: polymarket.com/leaderboard/overall/weekly/profit
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Scrape/analyze leaderboard data over time. 2. Identify top performers. 3. Track their public positions/trades via activity feed. 4. Look for patterns in market selection and timing. 5. Paper trade mimicking patterns.

evidence.observation: First analysis of top 5 weekly performers (wasianiversonworldchamp2025 +$1.56M, gmanas +$449K, primm +$272K, piastri +$242K, potko +$201K). Key findings: (1) 4/5 specialize in SPORTS markets (58-81% of trades), (2) All trade very high frequency (20+ trades/day), (3) All make occasional large concentrated bets (5x+ avg size), (4) All most active during morning 6-12 UTC, (5) Strong long/buy bias.

hypotheses.statement: High volume in low-probability sports outcomes indicates informed betting or arbitrage opportunities from other platforms
hypotheses.rationale: Carolina Panthers has $50M volume at only 1% probability for Super Bowl 2026. This is anomalous - volume usually correlates with probability. Possible explanations: (1) large arbitrage plays from sports books, (2) informed bettors accumulating, (3) pure speculation. If #1 or #2, following volume could be profitable.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Track volume/probability ratios across all Super Bowl outcomes. 2. Identify outliers where volume >> probability suggests. 3. Compare Polymarket odds to Vegas/offshore books. 4. Monitor if high-volume low-prob teams see probability increases over time.

evidence.observation: Initial scan: Panthers $50M volume at 1%, Bengals $37M at <1%, Cowboys $13.5M at <1%. All have volume vastly exceeding probability-adjusted expectations. Need to compare to Vegas lines and monitor for price movement.

hypotheses.statement: Related markets on Polymarket exhibit exploitable price discrepancies due to fragmented liquidity
hypotheses.rationale: Time POY 'Human' market shows 58.5% YES, implying 41.5% non-human. But the only non-human candidate (AI) in the main market is at 39%. This 2.5% gap may be exploitable. Similar patterns may exist in other related market pairs.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Identify related market pairs (Human/Non-human vs main market, conference vs team totals, etc.). 2. Calculate implied probabilities from each. 3. Look for gaps >2% after fees. 4. Paper trade arbitrage positions. 5. Track if gaps close over time.

evidence.observation: Time POY markets: AI = 39% in main market. 'Human' market = 58.5% (implies non-human 41.5%). Gap of 2.5%. However, need to account for trading fees and slippage. With 0.5-1% fees each side, net arbitrage may be <1%. Small but potentially positive.

trackingMarkets.pair: Time POY Human/Non-Human vs AI candidate

hypotheses.statement: Multi-outcome markets with close competitors misprice volatility, underweighting the probability of reversals
hypotheses.rationale: In the 'Largest Company end of 2025' market, NVDA is priced at 89% and AAPL at 9%, despite AAPL market cap being only 5-7% behind NVDA. Market may be extrapolating recent momentum rather than pricing in realistic volatility scenarios.
hypotheses.testMethod: Track multi-outcome markets where gap between leading outcomes is <10%. Compare market pricing to volatility-adjusted fair value. Execute trades where mispricing is detected.

evidence.observation: AAPL vs NVDA gap is ~5-7% ($200-300B) but market prices AAPL at only 9%. With 24 days of market volatility, a 5-7% swing is plausible. Opened position: 5,555 AAPL YES @ $0.09.

AAPL position update: price dropped from 9¢ to 8.45¢ (-6.1%). Unrealized P&L: -$30.55. Still above stop-loss (4¢). Market moving against us slightly but within expected volatility. 23 days remaining until resolution.

Market scan update: AAPL now at 7.8¢ (down from 9¢ entry, -13.3%). NVDA at 91% (up from 90%). Market continues trending toward incumbent (NVDA) despite close underlying fundamentals. Unrealized P&L: -$66.66. Position still above 4¢ stop-loss but hypothesis looking weaker. May need longer timeframe or stronger catalyst for reversal.

Portfolio review: AAPL at 7.5¢ (down from 9¢ entry, -16.7%). NVDA stable at 91%. Unrealized P&L: -$83.32. Position still 46% above 4¢ stop-loss. No exit criteria met. Hypothesis continues to face headwinds - market appears to be pricing in momentum rather than volatility potential. 23 days to resolution.

Experiment progress check: AAPL at 7.4¢ (down from 9¢ entry, -17.8%). NVDA stable at 91%. Unrealized P&L: -$88.88. Position still 85% above 4¢ stop-loss. Price has stabilized in the 7.4-7.5¢ range over past 24h after initial decline. No exit triggers met. 22 days to resolution. Watching for any macro catalyst (earnings, market cap news) that could trigger reversal.

Position closed at 6.6¢ (-26.7% from entry). AAPL dropped to 6.5% while NVDA rose to 92%. Market cap gap widened to ~8-10% (NVDA ~$4.5T vs AAPL ~$4.1T). Market correctly pricing in momentum continuation, not mean reversion. Realized loss: -$133.30.

hypotheses.conclusion: Invalidated. The hypothesis that multi-outcome markets underweight volatility was wrong in this case. The market correctly identified NVDA's momentum advantage. Key learnings: (1) Close market cap doesn't guarantee close probabilities - momentum matters, (2) Markets approaching resolution may become MORE efficient at pricing the likely winner, not less, (3) Fundamentals alone don't create trading edge - need information advantage or timing edge. Loss: -$133.30 (-26.7%).

hypotheses.statement: Sports betting markets on Polymarket offer better edge than politics/crypto markets
hypotheses.rationale: Analysis of top 5 weekly performers shows 4/5 specialize in sports (58-81% of their trades). Sports markets may have: (1) more inefficiencies due to rapid information flow, (2) better arbitrage vs traditional sportsbooks, (3) more predictable patterns. Derived from hyp-004 analysis.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Compare win rates across market categories (sports vs politics vs crypto). 2. Analyze spread/volume ratios. 3. Paper trade sports-focused strategy vs diversified strategy. 4. Track if sports specialists consistently outperform.

evidence.observation: 4/5 top weekly traders specialize in sports: gmanas (58%), 0x006cc834 (81%), primm (63%), piastri (73%). Combined weekly profit of these 4: $1.24M. Only wasianiversonworldchamp2025 focuses on 'other' category.

hypotheses.statement: High-frequency trading (20+ trades/day) on Polymarket correlates with top performance
hypotheses.rationale: All top 5 weekly performers trade at very high frequency (20+ trades/day). This could indicate: (1) more opportunities to capture small edges, (2) better risk distribution, (3) faster reaction to information. Derived from hyp-004 analysis.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Correlate trading frequency with profitability across broader sample. 2. Test if frequency alone predicts performance or if it's confounded with capital/skill. 3. Simulate high-frequency vs low-frequency approaches with same signals.

evidence.observation: All 5 top performers show 'very high (20+/day)' trading frequency. However, this may be survivorship bias - we're only looking at winners. Need to check if losing traders also trade frequently.

Deep HFT research completed. Key findings: (1) $40M extracted by arbitrage bots historically, (2) Top 3 arbitrage wallets made $4.2M from 10,200+ trades, (3) Market not saturated - 'one or two bots per market', (4) Sub-100ms latency achievable with $100-500/month infrastructure, (5) Open source implementations available. Graduated to strategy development: strat-002.

hypotheses.conclusion: Validated. Research confirms HFT/arbitrage approaches have extracted $40M+ on Polymarket. Top arb wallets made $4.2M from 10,200+ trades. Market not saturated. Graduated to strat-002 (Single-Market Arbitrage) for shadow mode testing.

hypotheses.statement: Concentrated high-conviction bets (5x+ average size) drive outsized returns on Polymarket
hypotheses.rationale: All top 5 performers make occasional very large bets (5x+ their average trade size). This suggests edge comes not from consistent small wins but from correctly identifying and sizing high-conviction opportunities. Derived from hyp-004 analysis.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Analyze P&L attribution - what % comes from large vs small trades? 2. Study the specific large trades - what made them confident? 3. Develop criteria for identifying high-conviction opportunities.

evidence.observation: Trade size analysis: wasianiversonworldchamp2025 avg $25K, largest $610K (24x). gmanas avg $7.5K, largest $119K (16x). primm avg $14K, largest $118K (8x). piastri avg $10K, largest $244K (24x). All show concentrated conviction pattern.

hypotheses.statement: Morning trading (6-12 UTC) on Polymarket offers timing advantage due to overnight information incorporation
hypotheses.rationale: All top 5 performers are most active during morning 6-12 UTC. This could reflect: (1) incorporating overnight news/results, (2) less competition from US traders (late night/early morning), (3) sports results from previous day settling. Derived from hyp-004 analysis.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Compare market efficiency (spread, price impact) across time zones. 2. Track if morning trades have better outcomes than afternoon/evening. 3. Analyze what events/information drive morning activity.

evidence.observation: 5/5 top traders most active during morning (6-12 UTC). This is 2-8am EST / 11pm-5am PST - off-peak for US traders. May indicate either timezone advantage (non-US traders) or deliberate strategy to trade when competition is lower.

hypotheses.statement: Multi-option markets with sum < $1.00 create risk-free arbitrage when buying all outcomes
hypotheses.rationale: Research shows this is a known arbitrage strategy on Polymarket. If total probability across all options < 100%, buying one share of each guarantees profit. Example: if sum = $0.995, buying all outcomes locks in $0.005 profit (0.5% yield). Top arbitrageurs made $20M+ using this.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Scan multi-outcome markets (Super Bowl, Person of Year, etc.) 2. Calculate sum of all option prices 3. When sum < $0.98, buy all outcomes 4. Hold to resolution for guaranteed profit 5. Track: opportunity frequency, execution speed vs competition

evidence.observation: Hypothesis directly contradicted by learning-arbitrage-reality-check-2025-12-08. Research attempted this exact strategy on AI model markets where mid-prices summed to 97.75%. Reality: ASK prices (what you actually pay) summed to >100%, eliminating the arbitrage. Example: Google mid 79.5% → ask 80.0%, OpenAI mid 12.1% → ask 12.8%, etc. Market makers capture the spread before retail traders can execute. "Risk-free arbitrage" does not exist at execution prices.

hypotheses.entryRules: Sum of all outcome prices < $0.98 (2%+ spread). Minimum $50 profit after fees. Can execute all buys within 60 seconds. Market has clear resolution criteria.
hypotheses.exitRules: Hold to resolution (guaranteed payout). Or exit if sum converges to $1.00 and can close at profit.
infrastructureRequired: Real-time price monitoring across all outcomes in multi-option markets

hypotheses.statement: NBA markets offer better edge than NFL due to higher game frequency and more statistical predictability
hypotheses.rationale: NBA has 82-game seasons with games daily, creating more trading opportunities. Basketball is higher-scoring and more stat-driven than football (less randomness). Polymarket shows NBA Champion market has $410M volume. Leaderboard analysis showed top traders focus on sports (4/5 specialists).
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Compare spreads and liquidity between NBA and NFL markets 2. Track if NBA specialists show higher win rates than NFL specialists 3. Paper trade NBA-focused strategy vs NFL-focused 4. Analyze predictability: NBA point spreads vs NFL spreads

observation.observation: Market scan: NBA Champion market shows 10M volume - among highest on platform. Daily NBA games provide frequent opportunities. NBA season ongoing through June provides sustained trading window. Leaderboard analysis showed 4/5 top traders focus on sports, suggesting edge exists in sports category.

hypotheses.conclusion: 0% confidence indicates this hypothesis lacks supporting evidence. NBA vs NFL edge comparison requires specific market data we haven't collected. Should reformulate with concrete testable criteria if we want to revisit.
hypotheses.entryRules: Focus on NBA player props and game outcomes. Avoid season-long futures. Enter when line is 2%+ off our model. Min liquidity $10k.
hypotheses.exitRules: Exit at game start or when line moves to our target. No holding through games initially.

hypotheses.statement: Endgame sweep strategy: buying outcomes at 95-99% probability right before resolution yields consistent returns
hypotheses.rationale: Research shows 90% of large orders ($10k+) execute at 95%+ prices. This suggests late-stage convergence to 100% creates small but reliable edge. Risk: wrong at 95% loses 95%. Reward: right at 95% gains 5%. Need 95%+ accuracy to profit.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Identify markets closing within 24-48h 2. Find outcomes priced 95-99% 3. Buy small positions 4. Track: actual win rate, avg price paid, profitability after fees
hypotheses.entryRules: Market closes within 48h. Outcome price 95-99%. Outcome is nearly certain based on our analysis. Max $100 per position (5% gain if right, 95% loss if wrong).
hypotheses.exitRules: Hold to resolution. No early exit unless outcome becomes uncertain.
hypotheses.notes: High win rate but low payoff. Needs very accurate outcome assessment. One wrong call at 99% wipes out 20 correct calls.

hypotheses.statement: Trump executive orders in first 100 days exceed historical baseline - market may underprice due to recency bias from second-term preparation
hypotheses.rationale: Trump signed 220 executive orders in first term (55/year). First 100 days of presidencies typically show highest EO activity. Trump second term likely to be more prepared with ready-to-sign orders. Markets may underprice this based on average expectations rather than first-100-days surge pattern.
hypotheses.testMethod: Find Trump EO markets on Polymarket. Compare market price to historical baseline plus second-term preparation advantage. Enter YES if market <65% for 40+ EOs in first 100 days.
hypotheses.entryRules: Market price <0.65 for Trump 40+ EOs in first 100 days (Jan 20-Apr 30, 2025). Min 0k liquidity.
hypotheses.exitRules: Take profit at 0.80 (+23%). Stop loss at 0.50 (-23%). Exit Jan 30 if pace is <10 EOs in first 10 days.

hypotheses.statement: Major tech earnings create exploitable volatility windows in related Polymarket markets 24-48h before announcements
hypotheses.rationale: When companies like NVIDIA, Apple, or Microsoft announce earnings, related markets (largest company, stock price targets, AI developments) become more volatile. Informed traders may position early, creating momentum we can follow or fade.
hypotheses.testMethod: Track major tech earnings calendar (NVDA, AAPL, MSFT, GOOGL, META). Monitor related Polymarket markets 48h before earnings. Look for price movements >5% that may signal informed positioning.
hypotheses.entryRules: Major tech earnings in 24-48h. Related market moves >5% in 24h. Strong directional volume confirms. Enter in direction of move if continuing, or fade if overextended.
hypotheses.exitRules: Exit before earnings announcement or at +15% profit / -10% loss.

hypotheses.statement: Following top sports traders' positions within 1 hour of execution captures profitable alpha
hypotheses.rationale: Leaderboard shows 4/5 top traders specialize in sports. Their public positions visible on activity feed. If we copy within 1h, may capture value before market fully adjusts. Risk: adverse selection if we're last money in.
hypotheses.testMethod: Track top 5 sports traders via API. When they make >000 bet, check if we can enter at similar price within 1h. Paper trade copying strategy.
hypotheses.entryRules: Top trader (wasianiversonworldchamp2025, gmanas, primm, piastri, potko) makes >k sports bet. Price hasn't moved >3% from their entry. Can deploy 0-100 within 1h.
hypotheses.exitRules: Exit when they exit (if visible) or at game resolution. Stop loss -20%.

hypotheses.statement: Geopolitical resolution markets overprice positive outcomes in final weeks of year due to optimism bias
hypotheses.rationale: End-of-year markets (Ukraine ceasefire 2025, Israel-Palestine peace, etc.) may exhibit optimism bias as news focuses on potential breakthroughs. Markets priced at 30-40% for unlikely December resolutions may be overpriced given historical resolution timelines typically take months/years. Our Ukraine ceasefire position at NO (60¢) tests this.
hypotheses.testMethod: Scan geopolitical markets closing Dec 31. Identify those requiring major breakthroughs in <23 days. Compare market prices to base rates of similar resolutions. Enter NO if market >35% for unlikely breakthrough.
hypotheses.entryRules: Geopolitical market closes Dec 31, 2025. Requires major diplomatic breakthrough. Market >0.35. Strong NO case based on timeline analysis. Min 0k volume.
hypotheses.exitRules: Take profit at market <0.25 (40%+ gain). Stop loss if major ceasefire/peace announcement emerges. Exit by Dec 29 before final 48h volatility.

evidence.observation: Position opened: Ukraine ceasefire NO @ 60¢ (41 shares, $24.60 cost). Market at 40% YES for ceasefire in remaining 22 days of 2025. Historical precedent: geopolitical conflicts take months/years to resolve, not weeks. Ukraine-Russia war ongoing since Feb 2022. Recent news shows continued fighting, no serious peace talks scheduled. 40% probability for December breakthrough appears optimistic given timeline constraints.

hypotheses.statement: Sports markets ($414.7M/week volume) offer superior edge compared to politics/crypto markets
hypotheses.rationale: Market scan Dec 2025 shows sports driving highest volume ($414.7M/week vs $322.6M politics). Leaderboard analysis (hyp-004) showed 4/5 top traders specialize in sports (58-81% of trades). Sports markets benefit from: rapid information flow, sportsbook arbitrage opportunities, and higher frequency trading cycles. Top performers demonstrate consistent edge.
hypotheses.testMethod: Paper trade focused sports strategy across NBA, NFL, poker markets. Target high-volume markets (>$10M). Compare win rate and P&L vs our non-sports positions. Track if sports specialization outperforms diversified approach.
hypotheses.entryRules: Sports market with >$10M volume. Clear pricing edge vs sportsbook lines OR momentum signal from top trader activity (wasianiversonworldchamp2025, gmanas, primm, piastri, potko). Max $100/position until strategy validated.
hypotheses.exitRules: Exit at event resolution or when pricing edge disappears. Stop loss -25% on pre-event positions. Hold through event if edge remains.

hypotheses.statement: High-probability markets (95-99%) closing within 48h exhibit final convergence that creates small but consistent arbitrage
hypotheses.rationale: Poker championship at 98% with $199M volume. Fed decision at 95% closing Dec 10. Research from hyp-009 shows 90% of large orders execute at 95%+ prices, suggesting late-stage convergence pattern. Risk: 5% gain if right vs 95% loss if wrong. Requires 97%+ accuracy.
hypotheses.testMethod: Scan for markets closing <48h priced 95-99%. Buy small positions on near-certain outcomes. Track win rate rigorously - need 97%+ to be profitable. Paper trade 20+ instances before committing capital.
hypotheses.entryRules: Market closes within 48h. Current price 95-99%. Outcome nearly certain based on our analysis (not just market price). Max $50/position to limit downside ($47.50 max loss if wrong).
hypotheses.exitRules: Hold to resolution for full payout. Only exit early if new information creates genuine outcome uncertainty. No profit-taking before resolution.

evidence.observation: Hypothesis contradicts learning-arbitrage-reality-check-2025-12-08: When attempting to execute multi-market arbitrage, ASK prices eliminate perceived opportunities. Mid-price calculations show 2.25% spreads that disappear when facing actual execution prices. Market makers already capture these edges. Additionally, the risk/reward is prohibitive: 5% gain if right vs 95% loss if wrong requires 97%+ accuracy - unrealistic for 48h outcome prediction.
Confidence remains very low (20%) without concrete market examples or testing. High-probability markets may not exhibit the convergence pattern we hypothesized.

hypotheses.statement: Fed rate decision markets show exploitable convergence when Polymarket diverges >3% from CME FedWatch in final 24-48h
hypotheses.rationale: Dec Fed decision has $296M volume at 95% for 25bps cut. CME FedWatch tool is institutional benchmark used by professional traders. When Polymarket price diverges >3% from FedWatch consensus, arbitrage opportunity exists as prices must converge before announcement.
hypotheses.testMethod: Monitor Fed decision markets 48h before FOMC meetings. Compare Polymarket probabilities to CME FedWatch. Enter when spread >3%. Next test: January 2025 FOMC meeting. Track convergence timing and profitability.
hypotheses.entryRules: Fed decision market 24-48h before FOMC announcement. Polymarket diverges >3% from CME FedWatch consensus probability. Min $100k volume for adequate liquidity.
hypotheses.exitRules: Exit when prices converge to <1% spread OR 2h before FOMC announcement (whichever first). Stop loss if Fed speakers/data signal unexpected outcome.

hypotheses.statement: Super Bowl playoff teams show exploitable pricing inefficiency when comparing Polymarket odds to Vegas consensus lines
hypotheses.rationale: Super Bowl market has $64.5M volume - highest on platform. Chiefs 21%, Lions 19%, Bills 14%, Eagles 13%. Vegas sportsbooks have deeper liquidity and sharper pricing. When Polymarket diverges >5% from Vegas consensus, arbitrage or value opportunity exists. Top traders (4/5) focus on sports markets suggesting edge exists.
hypotheses.testMethod: 1. Compare Polymarket Super Bowl odds to Vegas consensus (FanDuel, DraftKings, Caesars average). 2. Identify teams with >5% divergence. 3. Enter positions when Polymarket overprices vs Vegas (sell) or underprices (buy). 4. Track convergence as playoffs progress.
hypotheses.entryRules: Polymarket price diverges >5% from Vegas consensus. Team has played at least 14 games (sufficient sample). Minimum $5M market volume for liquidity. Can deploy $50-150 per position.
hypotheses.exitRules: Exit when odds converge to <2% spread OR team is eliminated from playoffs OR Super Bowl resolves. Take profit at +20%, stop loss at -25%.

hypotheses.statement: Google maintains "best AI model" dominance through year-end - market at 78% may undervalue given current 80% second-place pricing creates pricing pressure
hypotheses.rationale: Google leads "best AI model 2025" at 78% ($26M volume) AND "second best" at 80%. This creates logical inconsistency - if Google has 80% to be #2, they likely have >78% to be #1. Market may be underpricing #1 position. Gemini recent performance on benchmarks supports this. 22 days until resolution Dec 31.
hypotheses.testMethod: Compare Google's current Chatbot Arena score vs competitors. Monitor for OpenAI/Anthropic frontier model releases (94% prob OpenAI releases by Dec 31). Buy Google YES on "best AI" if price stays <80%. Exit if major model release threatens position or at resolution.
hypotheses.entryRules: Google "best AI model 2025" price <0.80. No major model releases announced from OpenAI/Anthropic in past 48h. Google maintains top Chatbot Arena score. Position size $50-100.
hypotheses.exitRules: Take profit at 0.88+ (10%+ gain). Stop loss if Google drops to #2 on Arena OR major competing model released. Hold to Dec 31 resolution if conditions stable.

hypotheses.statement: Bitcoin volatility creates profitable swing trades on daily price bracket markets during current $95k-$100k consolidation phase
hypotheses.rationale: Bitcoin currently consolidating in $95k-$100k range with 50/50 split (32% hits $100k, 40% drops to $80k by year-end). This uncertainty creates daily volatility perfect for bracket betting. High volume ($88M on year-end market) indicates liquid daily markets exist. Can exploit intraday swings.
hypotheses.testMethod: Trade daily Bitcoin price bracket markets. Buy brackets covering likely daily ranges based on recent volatility (typically $2-5k daily swings). Focus on 6-12 UTC morning session when volume spikes. Track win rate over 10+ trades.
hypotheses.entryRules: Bitcoin daily bracket market available. Current BTC price within $95k-$105k consolidation range. Implied volatility from options >40%. Buy bracket that captures 70% probability cone. Max $75 per position.
hypotheses.exitRules: Hold to daily resolution (typically 24h). No early exit unless BTC breaks consolidation range ($105k+ or <$90k) suggesting regime change.

hypotheses.statement: NBA Thunder championship odds (34%) underpriced relative to their regular season dominance and statistical profile
hypotheses.rationale: Oklahoma City Thunder lead Polymarket at 34% for NBA championship. Celtics collapsed from 26% to 1%, suggesting market responsive to performance. Thunder currently top of Western Conference with elite defense and young core. $410M volume on NBA champion market shows liquidity. Sports specialists (4/5 top traders) focus here per hyp-004.
hypotheses.testMethod: Compare Thunder 34% Polymarket odds to traditional sportsbook odds for NBA championship. If Polymarket is 5%+ lower than Vegas consensus, buy Thunder YES. Track through playoffs starting April 2026. Monitor regular season performance as signal.
hypotheses.entryRules: Thunder Polymarket price 5%+ below Vegas consensus odds. Thunder maintain top-2 Western Conference seed. No major injuries to key players (SGA, Chet, Jalen Williams). Position size $100-200.
hypotheses.exitRules: Exit if Thunder drop below 4-seed OR suffer major injury OR Polymarket converges to Vegas odds (+20% profit). Stop loss at -30% if team underperforms. Otherwise hold to championship resolution June 2026.
